===Research/advertising (not product) machines === * [[IBM Columbia Difference Tabulator]]: 1931<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.columbia.edu/cu/computinghistory/packard.html|title=The Columbia Difference Tabulator - 1931}}</ref> * [[Harvard Mark I|IBM ASCC]]: Automatic Sequence Controlled Calculator (aka. Harvard Mark I); 1944 * [[IBM SSEC]]: Selective Sequence Electronic Calculator; 1948<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.columbia.edu/acis/history/ssec.html|title=The IBM Selective Sequence Electronic Calculator}}</ref> * [[IBM Deep Blue]]: Chess playing computer developed for 1997 match with [[Garry Kasparov]] * [[IBM Watson]]: An [[artificial intelligence|artificially intelligent]] computer system capable of answering questions posed in [[natural language]], specifically developed to answer questions on the [[quiz show]] ''[[Jeopardy!]]''.<ref>[http://ibmresearchnews.blogspot.com/2011/12/dave-ferrucci-at-computer-history.html ''... in 2007, when IBM executive Charles Lickel challenged Dave and his team to revolutionize Deep QA and put an IBM computer against Jeopardy!'s human champions, he was off to the races.'']</ref>
===Retail/point-of-sale (POS)=== * [[IBM 3650]]: Retail Store System; 1973 * [[IBM 3660]]: Supermarket System; 1973 * [[IBM 3663]]: Supermarket Terminal; 1973<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www-03.ibm.com/ibm/history/exhibits/vintage/vintage_4506VV4020.html|work=IBM Archives|publisher=IBM|title=IBM 3663 supermarket terminal}}</ref> * [[IBM 4610]]: SureMark Retail Printer [http://www-03.ibm.com/products/retail/products/] * [[IBM 4683]]: PC Based Retail System; 1987 * [[IBM 4693]]: PC Based Retail System * [[IBM 4694]]: PC Based Retail System * [[IBM SurePOS 300]]: Cost effective PC Based Retail System [http://www-03.ibm.com/products/retail/products/pos/300/] * [[IBM SurePOS 500]]: All in one PC Based Retail System [http://www-03.ibm.com/products/retail/products/pos/500/] * [[IBM SurePOS 700]]: High performance PC Based Retail System [http://www-03.ibm.com/products/retail/products/pos/700/] * [[IBM SureOne]]: PC Based Retail System * [[AnyPlace POS]]: Customer touch screen Kiosk [http://www-03.ibm.com/products/retail/products/anyplacepos/index.html]
===Telecommunications=== * International Time Recording Co. Series 970: Telephone System (1930s)<ref name=ITRcat/> * SAIS (Semi-Automatic Intercept System): Added automated custom [[Intercept message|intercept messages]] to the [[Bell System]]'s operator-based centralized intercept system, using a computer-controlled [[Drum memory|magnetic drum]] audio playback medium. Late 1960s. * [[IBM 1750, 2750 and 3750 Switching Systems|IBM 1750]]: Switching System * [[IBM 1750, 2750 and 3750 Switching Systems|IBM 1755]]: Operator station * [[IBM 1750, 2750 and 3750 Switching Systems|IBM 2750]]: Switching System * [[IBM 1750, 2750 and 3750 Switching Systems|IBM 3750]]: Switching System *[[IBM 8750 Business Communication System|IBM 8750]]: Business Communications System * [[ROLM|IBM 9750]]: Business Communications System (ROLM) * [[ROLM|IBM 9751]]: CBX: Main component of 9750 system * [[IBM Simon]]: Smartphone; 1994
===Unclassified=== <!-- Below need to be moved into the appropriate category --> * [[IBM 6361]]: Fastdraft system; 1982, a low-cost drafting system using a light pen and a CRT screen.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www-03.ibm.com/ibm/history/history/year_1982.html|title=1980s|work=IBM Archives|publisher=IBM|accessdate=2013-10-26}}</ref> *[[IBM TouchMobile]] a hand-held computer announced in 1993<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thefreelibrary.com/IBM%27S+TOUCHMOBILE+HELPS+FIELD+WORKERS+COLLECT+DATA+AT+THE+TOUCH+OF+A...-a013107603|title=IBM'S TOUCHMOBILE HELPS FIELD WORKERS COLLECT DATA AT THE TOUCH OF A FINGER|publisher=The Free Library by Farlex|accessdate=10 December 2017}}</ref>
==Computer software== Some software listings are for software families, not products (''Fortran'' was not a product; ''Fortran H'' was a product).
Some IBM software products were distributed free (no charge for the software itself, a common practice early in the industry). The term "Program Product" was used by IBM to denote that it's freely available<ref>Unlike a [[Request price quotation |PRPQ]].</ref> but not for free.<ref name="unbundling-announcement">{{cite web|url=http://archive.computerhistory.org/resources/access/text/2014/06/102712825/102712825-05-01-acc.pdf|title=IBM Announcement of Program Products/SHARE 1969|date=June 23, 1969}}</ref> Prior to June 1969, the majority of software packages written by IBM were available at no charge to IBM customers; with the June 1969 announcement, new software not designated as "System Control Programming" became Program Products, although existing non-system software remained available for free.<ref name="unbundling-announcement"/>
===Operating systems=== * [[IBM AIX|AIX]], IBM's family of proprietary UNIX OS's (Advanced Interactive eXecutive) on multiple platforms * BPS/360 [[IBM Basic Programming Support|(Basic Programming Support/360)]] * [[BOS/360]] (Basic Operating System/360) * [[TOS/360]] (Tape Operating System/360) * DM2, Disk Monitor System Version 2 for the [[IBM 1130]] * [[DOS/360]] ([[Disk operating system|Disk Operating System]]/360) * [[DOS/VS]] (Disk Operating System/Virtual Storage—370), virtual memory successor to DOS/360 ** [[DOS/VSE]] (Virtual Storage Extended—370, 4300) ** [[VSE/ESA]] (Virtual Storage Extended/Enterprise System Architecture) ** [[z/VSE]] for [[z/Architecture]] * [[DPCX]] (Distributed Processing Control eXecutive) for [[IBM 8100]] * [[IBM DPPX|DPPX]] (Distributed Processing Programming eXecutive) for [[IBM 8100]] and, later, the [[ES/9370]] * CPF (Control Program Facility) for the [[System/38]] * [[IBM i]], previously i5/OS and OS/400, successor to CPF for [[AS/400]], [[IBM Power Systems]], and [[PureSystems]] * [[IBSYS]] ([[IBM 7090]]/[[IBM 7094|94]] operating system) * IX/370 An IBM proprietary UNIX OS (Interactive eXecutive for [[IBM System/370]]) * Model 44 Programming System for the [[IBM System/360 Model 44|System/360 Model 44]] * [[OS/360 and successors|OS/360]] (Operating System/360 for [[IBM System/360]]) ** [[OS/360 and successors#PCP|PCP]] (Primary Control Program option) ** [[OS/360 and successors#MFT|MFT]] (Multiprogramming with a Fixed number of Tasks option) ** [[OS/360 and successors#MVT|MVT]] (Multiprogramming with a Variable number of Tasks option) *** [[OS/360 and successors#M65MP|M65MP]] (Model 65 Multiprocessor option) * [[OS/VS1]] (Operating System—Virtual Storage 1) for [[IBM System/370]], virtual memory successor to MFT * OS/VS2 (Operating System—Virtual Storage 2) for IBM System/370, virtual memory successor to MVT **[[OS/VS2 (SVS)|SVS]]: Release 1 (Single Virtual Storage) ** [[MVS]]: Release 2-3.8 (Multiple Virtual address Spaces) *** [[MVS#MVS/370|MVS/370]] (OS/VS2 2.0-3.8, MVS/SE, MVS/SP V1) **** MVS/SE: MVS System Extensions ***** Release 1: based on OS/VS2 R3.7 plus selectable units ***** Release 2: based on OS/VS2 R3.8 plus selectable units **** MVS/SP: MVS/System Product, replacement for MVS/SE ***** MVS/SP V3 ***** MVS/ESA SP V4 ***** MVS/ESA SP V5 *** [[MVS#MVS/XA|MVS/XA]] (Multiple Virtual Systems—Extended Architecture): MVS/SP V2 *** [[MVS#MVS/ESA|MVS/ESA]] (Multiple Virtual Systems—Enterprise Systems Architecture) * [[OS/390]], successor to MVS for [[IBM System/390]] * [[z/OS]], successor to OS/390 for [[z/Architecture]] and, up through Version 1.5, System/390 * [[OS/2]] (Operating System/2) for the IBM [[PS/2]] * [[PC DOS]] ([[IBM PC|Personal Computer]] Disk Operating System) * [[System Support Program]] for System/34, System/36 * [[Transaction Processing Facility]], formerly [[IBM Airline Control Program]] (ACP) * [[TSS/360]] (Time Sharing System, a failed predecessor to VM/CMS, intended for the [[IBM System/360 Model 67]]) * [[CP-67]] May refer to either a package for the [[IBM System/360 Model 67|360/67]] or only to the Control program of that package. * [[CP/CMS]] Another name for the CP-67 package for the 360/67; predecessor to VM. * [[VM (operating system)|VM]], sometimes called VM/CMS (Virtual Machine/Conversational Monitor System) Successor systems to [[CP-67]] for the S/370 and later machines. First appeared as Virtual Machine Facility/370 and most recently as [[z/VM]]. ** VM/SE Virtual Machine/System Extension, also known as System Extension Program Product (SEPP). An enhancement to Virtual Machine Facility/370, replaced by VM/SP. ** VM/BSE Virtual Machine/Basic System Extension, also known as Basic System Extension Program Product (BSEPP). An enhancement to Virtual Machine Facility/370, providing some of the facilities of VM/se, replaced by VM/SP. ** VM/SP Virtual Machine/System Product, replacing VM/SE and the base for all future VM versions. ** VM/XA Virtual Machine/Extended Architecture 31-bit VM ** [[VM/ESA]] (Virtual Machine/Enterprise System Architecture) * [[4690 OS]] (retail)
===Utilities and languages=== * [[A20 handler]] for the PC (address line 20 handler) * [[Ada (programming language)|Ada]] * [[ALGOL 60]] Included in [[OS/360 and successors|OS/360]] * [[APL (programming language)|APL]] * [[Autocoder]] macro assemblers for various machines, with nothing in common but the name * [[COBOL]] (Common Business Oriented Language) * [[IBM Compilers]] (formerly [[VisualAge]] compilers (C/C++, Fortran, Java, ...)) * [[IBM Cross System Product (CSP)|CSP]] (Cross System Product) * [[Eclipse (software)|Eclipse]] an IDE * [[Enterprise Generation Language|EGL]] (Enterprise Generation Language) * [[FARGO (programming language)|FARGO]] (Fourteen-o-one Automatic Report Generation Operation). Predecessor of [[RPG programming language|RPG]] for the [[IBM 1401]] * [[FORTRAN Assembly Program|FAP]] assembler for the IBM 709, 7090, and 7094 (FORTRAN Assembly Program) * [[Fortran#History|FORTRAN]] <!-- Please do not change this one to modern "Fortran" form --> (originally developed by IBM for the 704) (FORmula TRANslator) * [[IBM Information Access]] Gave customers access to the Retain and PTF databases, circa 1981 * [[ISPF]] Interactive System Productivity Facility. An IDE for MVS and z/OS systems * [[Job Control Language|JCL]] batch job language for [[OS/360 and successors]] * [[Job Entry Subsystem 1 (JES1)|JES1]], [[Job Entry Subsystem 2/3|JES2 and JES3]], job entry and [[spooling]] subsystems * MAP (Macro Assembly Program in the IBJOB component of [[IBM 7090/94 IBSYS|IBSYS]]) * [[Pascal (programming language)|Pascal]] * [[PL/I]] (Programming Language/One) * [[IBM PL/S|PL/S]] (Programming Language/Systems), originally named BSL (Basic Systems Language), later PL/AS, PL/X * [[IBM Power (software)|Power]] spooler for [[DOS/360]] and successors * [[REXX]] scripting language (REstructured eXtended eXecutor) * [[IBM RPG|RPG]] (Report Program Generator) ** RPG for IBM 1401 and System/360 ** [[RPG II]] for [[System/3]], [[System/32]], [[System/34]], [[System/36]], and [[IBM System/370|System/370]] ** [[RPG III]] for [[System/38]], its successor [[AS/400]], and System/370 ** RPG IV for RISC AS/400 and other machines running [[IBM i]] * SOAP (Symbolic Optimal Assembly Program for [[IBM 650]]) * SPS ([[Symbolic Programming System]]). An assembler<ref>1401 SPS and 1620 SPS were incompatible</ref> for [[IBM 1401]] or [[IBM 1620]] systems, less capable than Autocoder * [[XEDIT]] an editor for VM/CMS systems
===Middleware and applications=== IBM distributes its diverse collection of software products over several brands; mainly: # IBM's own branding for many software products originally developed in-house; # Lotus: collaboration and communication; # Rational: software development and maintenance; # Tivoli: management, operations, and Cloud; {{Main article|Tivoli Software}} # WebSphere: Internet. {{Main article|IBM WebSphere}} #Watson Main article: [[Watson (computer)|IBM Watson]] {{clear}} *[[IBM 709/90 9PAC|9PAC]] Report generator for the IBM 7090 (709 PACkage) * [[IBM Administrative Terminal System]] (ATS) Online Text Entry, Editing, Processing, Storage and Retrieval * [[IBM Advanced Text Management System]] (ATMS) A CICS-based successor to ATS, ATMS served as the text entry system for STorage And Retrieval System ([[IBM STAIRS|STAIRS]]) * [[IBM Assistant Series]] (Filing Assistant, Reporting Assistant, Graphing Assistant, Writing Assistant and Planning Assistant) * [[IBM Audio Distribution System]] * [[IBM BS12]] (IBM Business System 12) * [[CICS|IBM CICS]] (Customer Information Control System) * IBM [[CICS Transaction Gateway]] * IBM CICS Web interpreter, [[IBM OD390]] * [[Apache Derby|IBM Cloudscape]] Pure Java Database Server. Now open source [[Apache Derby]] * [[IBM Cognos Business Intelligence]] Business Intelligence Suite * [[IBM Concurrent Copy]], backup software * [[IBM Content Manager OnDemand]] (CMOD) <ref>https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/ibm-content-manager-ondemand</ref> * [[IBM DB2]] Relational DBMS (DataBase 2) * IBM DB2 Content Manager * [[IBM DB2 Document Manager]] * [[IBM DB2 Records Manager]] * [[IBM Deep Computing Visualization for Linux V1.2]] * [[IBM DISOSS]] Distributed Office Support System * IBM Document Composition Facility (DCF),<ref>{{cite web | title = DCF V1R4.0 Documentation Bookshelf | url = http://publibfp.dhe.ibm.com/cgi-bin/bookmgr/Shelves/dsm0pa04 | date = August 8, 2001 | publisher = IBM | format = HTML | mode = cs2 }}</ref> previously known as [[SCRIPT (markup)|SCRIPT/VS]] * IBM Document Library Facility (DLF) * IBM BookMaster <ref>{{cite web | title = BookMaster V1R4.0 Bookshelf product on Printing and Publishing CD | url = http://publibz.boulder.ibm.com/cgi-bin/bookmgr_OS390/Shelves/edf01a02 | date = August 1, 1995 | publisher = IBM | format = HTML | mode = cs2 }}</ref> * IBM BookManager<ref>{{cite web | title = BookManager Bookshelf | url = http://publibz.boulder.ibm.com/cgi-bin/bookmgr_OS390/Shelves?filter=bookmanager&SUBMIT=Find | year = 2005 | publisher = IBM | format = HTML | mode = cs2 }}</ref> * [[FileNet|IBM FileNet]] products, P8 Business Process Management and Enterprise Content Management ([[FileNet]] bought by IBM) * [[GDDM|IBM Graphical Data Display Manager]] (GDDM). * [[IBM Generalized Information System]] (GIS). * [[IBM HTTP Server]] * [[i2 Limited|IBM i2]] Analyst's Notebook and COPLINK<ref>{{Cite web |title= i2 is now part of IBM |url= http://www-01.ibm.com/software/industry/i2software/ |work= IBM web site |accessdate= September 29, 2013 }}</ref> * [[IBM Information Management System]] (IMS) Hierarchical database management system (DBMS) * [[IBM Informix Dynamic Server]] * [[cc:Mail|IBM Lotus cc:Mail]] * [[IBM Lotus Connections]] * [[IBM Lotus Expeditor]] * [[IBM Lotus QuickPlace]] * [[IBM Lotus Quickr]] * [[IBM Lotus Notes]] ([[Lotus Software|Lotus Development]] was bought by IBM in 1995) * [[IBM Lotus Sametime]] * [[IBM Lotus SmartSuite]] Office Suite * [[IBM Lotus Symphony]] Office Suite * IBM Maximo Asset Management * [[IBM Network Design and Analysis]] (NETDA) * [[IBM Network Performance Monitor]] (NPM) * [[IBM OfficeVision]] (originally named PROFS) * [[IBM OMEGAMON]] * [[IBM Personal Communications]] Emulator, also known as Host Access Client * IBM Print Management Facility (PMF) * IBM Print Services Facility (PSF) * [[IBM QualityStage]] Acquired from Ascential * [[Rational Software]]'s products (Rational bought by IBM in 2003) * [[IBM Rational Application Developer]] * [[IBM Rational Software Architect]] * [[IBM Rational System Architect]] * [[IBM Rational Asset Manager]] * [[IBM Rational Automation Framework]] Previously known as IBM Rational Automation Framework for WebSphere * [[IBM Red Brick Database Server]] * [[IBM RFID Information Center]] (RFIDIC) Tracking and tracing products through supply chains * [[IBM Screen Definition Facility II]] (SDF II), a software tool for the interactive development of screen definition panels.<ref name="IBMSDFII">{{cite web |title= Screen Definition Facility II |url= http://www-01.ibm.com/software/awdtools/sdf/ |publisher= IBM |website= ibm.com |access-date= 25 February 2017}}</ref> * [[IBM SearchManager]] text search, successor to STAIRS * [[IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager]] * [[IBM Softek TDMF]] * [[IBM STAIRS|IBM STorage And Information Retrieval System]] (STAIRS) Text search * [[IBM Sterling B2B Integrator]] * [[IBM TPNS|IBM Teleprocessing Network Simulator]] (TPNS) * [[IBM Tivoli Access Manager]] (TAM) * [[IBM Tivoli Application Dependency Discovery Manager]] ([[TADDM]]) * [[IBM Tivoli Asset Manager for IT]] ([[TAMIT]]) * [[IBM Tivoli Framework]] ([[Tivoli Systems, Inc.|Tivoli Systems]] was bought by IBM in 1995) * [[IBM Tivoli Change and Configuration Management Database]] ([[CCMDB]]) * [[IBM Tivoli Compliance Insight Manager]] ([[TCIM]]) * [[IBM Tivoli Monitoring]] * [[IBM Tivoli Netview]] * [[IBM Tivoli Netcool]] * IBM [[Tivoli Provisioning Manager]] * IBM [[Tivoli Service Automation Manager]] * [[IBM Tivoli Storage Manager]] (Formerly ADSM, moved to Tivoli in 1999) * IBM Tivoli Storage Manager FastBack * [[IBM Tivoli Workload Scheduler]] * [[IBM Tivoli System Automation]] * [[IBM U2]], including IBM UniVerse and IBM UniData [[Dimensional database]] DBMS * [[IBM ViaVoice]] Dictation (early version: IBM VoiceType) * [[IBM Virtualization Engine]] * [[Virtual Storage Personal Computing|IBM VSPC]] * [[IBM WebSphere]] * [[IBM WebSphere Application Server]] * [[IBM WebSphere Adapters]] * [[IBM Websphere Business Events]] * [[IBM WebSphere Banking Transformation Toolkit]] * [[IBM Websphere Host On-Demand]] (HOD) Host On-Demand Web-based TN3270, TN5250 and VT440 Terminal Emulation. * [[IBM WebSphere Message Broker]] * [[IBM WebSphere MQ]] (previously known as IBM MQSeries) * [[IBM WebSphere Portal]] * [[IBM WebSphere Portlet Factory]] * [[IBM WebSphere Process Server]] * [[WebSphere Service Registry and Repository]] * [[IBM Worklight]] (Mobile application platform) * [[IBM Workplace Web Content Management]] (IWWCM) Web content management for WebSphere Portal and Domino servers (Presence Online dba Aptrix bought by IBM in 2003) * [[IBM Works]] Office suite for OS/2 * [[TOURCast]] * [[CoScripter]] * ICCF Interactive Computing and Control Facility. An interactive editor that runs under CICS on DOS/VSE. Now included as part of "VSE Central Functions." * NCCF Network Communications Control Facility. A network monitoring and control subsystem
==== Watson Customer Engagement ==== The Watson Customer Engagement (commonly known as WCE and formerly known as IBM Commerce) business unit supports marketing, commerce, and supply chain software development and product offerings for IBM. Software and solutions offered as part of these three portfolios by WCE are as follows:
===== Watson Marketing Portfolio ===== * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/digital-marketing-and-lead-management Watson Campaign Automation] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/session-replay-and-interaction-analytics IBM Tealeaf] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/omni-channel-campaign-management IBM Campaign] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/customer-experience-analytics Customer Experience Analytics] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/predictive-customer-analytics-on-cloud Watson Marketing Insights] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/journey-mapping IBM Journey Designer] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/real-time-personalization Watson Real-Time Personalization] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/cloud-cms-solution Watson Content Hub]
===== Watson Commerce ===== * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/cpq-software IBM Configure, Price, Quote] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/commerce-on-cloud IBM Digital Commerce] * [[WebSphere Commerce|IBM WebSphere Commerce]] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/omni-channel-commerce Watson Commerce Insights] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/order-management-platform IBM Order Management] * [https://www-01.ibm.com/software/commerce/order-management/store/ IBM Store Engagement] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/omni-channel-fulfillment Watson Order Optimizer] * [http://www-03.ibm.com/software/products/en/call-center IBM Call Center]
* IBM Inventory Visibility * IBM Watson Pay * IBM Payment Gateway * IBM Dynamic Pricing * IBM Price Optimization * IBM Price Management * IBM Markdown Optimization * Forms Experience Builder
===== Watson Supply Chain ===== * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/partner-collaboration-network IBM Supply Chain Business Network] * [https://www.ibm.com/us-en/marketplace/high-volume-secure-file-transfer IBM Connect:Direct] * IBM Supply Chain Insights * IBM B2B Integration Portfolio * IBM Strategic Supply Management
==Data centers== [[File:IBMPortableModularDataCenter.jpg|thumb|right|A 40-foot [[Portable Modular Data Center]].]] * [[Portable Modular Data Center]] * Scalable Modular Data Center
==Services== * [[Call/360]] timesharing service (1968)<ref>{{cite news|title=IBM Computer|newspaper=St. Petersburg Independent|date=June 11, 1968}}</ref> * [[IBM]]'s service bureau business: an in-house service, offered until 1957. See SBC, below. * [[Silverpop]], an Atlanta-based software company<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.adweek.com/digital/ibm-buys-silverpop-cloud-based-acquisitions-pool-dries-156940/ |title=IBM buys Silverpop, cloud-based acquisitions pool dries |publisher=adweek.com |accessdate=November 21, 2017}}</ref> * [[Service Bureau Corporation]] (SBC) was a subsidiary of IBM formed in 1957 to operate IBM's former service bureau business as an independent company. In 1973 sold to Control Data Corporation,
==See also== * [[History of IBM magnetic disk drives]] * [[History of hard disk drives]] * [[OS/360 and successors]] * [[:Category:IBM products]]
==Notes and references== {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== {{Commons category|IBM products}} * [http://www-03.ibm.com/ibm/history/exhibits/mainframe/mainframe_FT1.html IBM Mainframe Family tree & chronology] * [http://www-03.ibm.com/ibm/history/exhibits/storage/storage_basic.html IBM Storage basic information sources]

page.title: List of International Electrotechnical Commission standards

revision.comment: fixed [[MOS:DASH|dashes]] using a [[User:GregU/dashes.js|script]]
revision.text:
{{Use British (Oxford) English|date=December 2011}} {{Expand list|date=August 2008}} This is an incomplete '''list of standards published by the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]]''' (IEC).
The numbers of older IEC standards were converted in 1997 by adding 60000; for example IEC 27 became IEC 60027. IEC standards often have multiple sub-part documents; only the main title for the standard is listed here.
* [[IEC 60027]] Letter symbols to be used in electrical technology * IEC 60028 International standard of resistance for copper * [[IEC 60034]] Rotating electrical machines * [[IEC 60038]] IEC Standard Voltages * IEC 60041 Field acceptance tests to determine the hydraulic performance of hydraulic turbines, storage pumps and pump-turbines * IEC 60044 Instrument [[transformer]]s * IEC 60045 Steam turbines * IEC 60050 [[International Electrotechnical Vocabulary]] * IEC 60051 Direct acting indicating analogue electrical measuring instruments and their accessories * IEC 60052 Voltage measurement by means of standard air gaps * IEC 60055 Paper-insulated metal-sheathed cables for rated voltages up to 18/30 kV (with copper or aluminium conductors and excluding gas-pressure and oil-filled cables) * IEC 60059 IEC standard current ratings * IEC 60060 High-voltage test techniques * IEC 60061 Lamp caps and holders together with gauges for the control of interchangeability and safety * [[IEC 60062]] Marking codes for resistors and capacitors * [[IEC 60063]] [[Preferred number]] series for resistors and capacitors * IEC 60064 Tungsten filament lamps for domestic and similar general lighting purposes – Performance requirements * IEC 60065 Audio, video and similar electronic apparatus – Safety requirements * IEC 60067 Dimensions of electronic tubes and valves * [[IEC 60068]] Environmental testing * IEC 60071 Insulation co-ordination * IEC 60072 Dimensions and output series for rotating electrical machines * IEC 60073 Basic and safety principles for man-machine interface, marking and identification – Coding principles for indicators and actuators * IEC 60076 [[Power transformer]]s * IEC 60077 Railway applications – Electric equipment for rolling stock * IEC 60079 [[Electrical equipment in hazardous areas|Explosive atmospheres]] * IEC 60081 Double-capped fluorescent lamps – Performance specifications * IEC 60083 [[AC power plugs and socket-outlets|Plugs and socket-outlets]] for domestic and similar general use standardized in member countries of IEC * IEC 60085 Electrical insulation – Thermal evaluation and designation * [[IEC 60086]] Primary [[battery (electricity)|batteries]]; * IEC 60092 Electrical installations in ships * IEC 60094 Magnetic tape sound recording and reproducing systems * IEC 60095 Lead-acid starter [[Battery (electricity)|batteries]] * IEC 60096 Radio frequency cables * IEC 60098 Rumble measurement on Vinyl Disc Turntables * IEC 60099 Surge arresters * IEC 60100 Methods for the measurement of direct inter-electrode capacitance of electronic tubes and valves * IEC 60104 Aluminium-magnesium-silicon alloy wire for overhead line conductors * IEC 60105 Recommendation for commercial-purity aluminium busbar material * IEC 60107 Methods of measurement on receivers for television broadcast transmissions * IEC 60110 Power capacitors for induction heating installations * [[IEC 60112]] Method for the determination of the proof and the comparative tracking indices of solid insulating materials * IEC 60114 Recommendation for heat-treated aluminium alloy busbar material of the aluminium-magnesium-silicon type * IEC 60115 Fixed resistors for use in electronic equipment * IEC 60118 [[Electroacoustics]] – Hearing aids * IEC 60119 The Electrical Performance of Semiconductor Rectifiers (Metal Rectifiers) (Withdrawn) * IEC 60120 Dimensions of ball and socket couplings of string insulator units * IEC 60121 Recommendation for commercial annealed aluminium electrical conductor wire * IEC 60122 Quartz crystal units of assessed quality * IEC 60127 Miniature fuses * IEC 60130 Connectors for frequencies below 3 MHz * IEC 60134 Rating systems for electronic tubes and valves and analogous semiconductor devices * IEC 60135 Numbering of electrodes and designation of units in electronic tubes and valves * IEC 60136 Dimensions of brushes and brush-holders for electrical machinery * IEC 60137 Insulated bushings for alternating voltages above 1000 V * IEC 60139 Preparation of outline drawings for cathode-ray tubes, their components, connections and gauges * IEC 60141 Tests on oil-filled and gas-pressure cables and their accessories * IEC 60143 Series capacitors for power systems * IEC 60146 Semiconductor converters – General requirements and line commutated converters * IEC 60151 Measurements of the electrical properties of electronic tubes and valves * IEC 60152 Identification by hour numbers of the phase conductors of 3-phase electric systems * IEC 60153 Hollow metallic waveguides * IEC 60154 Flanges for waveguides * IEC 60155 Glow-starters for fluorescent lamps * IEC 60156 Insulating liquids – Determination of the breakdown voltage at power frequency * IEC 60168 Tests on indoor and outdoor post insulators of ceramic material or glass for systems with nominal voltages greater than 1000 V * IEC 60169 Radio-frequency connectors * IEC 60172 Test procedure for the determination of the temperature index of enamelled and tape wrapped winding wires * IEC 60183 Guidance for the selection of high-voltage A.C. cable systems * IEC 60188 High-pressure mercury vapour lamps – Performance specifications * IEC 60189 Low-frequency cables and wires with PVC insulation and PVC sheath * IEC 60191 Mechanical standardization of semiconductor devices * IEC 60192 Low-pressure sodium vapour lamps – Performance specifications * IEC 60193 Hydraulic turbines, storage pumps and pump-turbines – Model acceptance tests * IEC 60194 Printed board design, manufacture and assembly – Terms and definitions * IEC 60195 Method of measurement of current noise generated in fixed resistors * IEC 60196 IEC standard frequencies * IEC 60197 High-voltage connecting wire with flame retarding insulation for use in television receivers * IEC 60204 Safety of machinery – Electrical equipment of machines * IEC 60205 Calculation of the effective parameters of magnetic piece parts * IEC 60211 Maximum demand indicators, Class 1.0 * IEC 60212 Standard conditions for use prior to and during the testing of solid electrical insulating materials * IEC 60214 Tap-changers * IEC 60215 Safety requirements for radio transmitting equipment * IEC 60216 Electrical insulating materials – Thermal endurance properties * IEC 60227 Polyvinyl chloride insulated cables of rated voltages up to and including 450/750 V * [[IEC 60228]] Conductors of insulated cables * IEC 60229 Electric cables – Tests on extruded over-sheaths with a special protective function * IEC 60230 Impulse tests on cables and their accessories * IEC 60231 General principles of nuclear reactor instrumentation * IEC 60233 Tests on Hollow Insulators for use in Electrical and protocols * [[IEC 62365]] Digital audio – Digital input-output interfacing – Transmission of digital audio over asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) networks * [[IEC 62366]] Medical devices – Application of usability engineering to medical devices * IEC 62368 Audio/video, information and communication technology equipment * [[IEC 62379]] Common control interface for networked digital audio and video products * IEC 62384 DC or AC supplied electronic control gear for LED modules – Performance requirements * [[IEC 62386]] Digital addressable lighting interface * IEC 62388 Maritime Navigation and Radio Communications, Shipborne Radar * IEC 62395 Electrical resistance trace heating systems for industrial and commercial applications * IEC 62420 Concentric lay stranded overhead electrical conductors containing one or more gap(s) * IEC 62439 Industrial communication networks – High availability automation networks * IEC 62443 Industrial communication networks – Network and system security (DRAFT) * IEC 62446 Grid connected photovoltaic systems – Minimum requirements for system documentation, commissioning tests and inspection * [[IEC 62455]] Internet protocol (IP) and transport stream (TS) based service access * IEC 62464 Magnetic resonance equipment for medical imaging * IEC 62471 Photobiological safety of lamps and lamp systems * IEC 62474 Material declaration for products of and for the electrotechnical industry * IEC 62481 [[Digital Living Network Alliance]] (DLNA) home networked device interoperability guidelines * IEC 62491 Industrial systems, installations and equipment and industrial products – Labelling of cables and cores * IEC 62493 Assessment of lighting equipment related to human exposure to electromagnetic fields * IEC 62502 Analysis techniques for dependability – [[Event tree analysis]] (ETA) * IEC 62504 General lighting – Light emitting diode (LED) products and related equipment – Terms and definitions * IEC 62505 Railway applications – Fixed installations – Particular requirements for a.c. switchgear * IEC 62507 Identification systems enabling unambiguous information interchange – Requirements * IEC 62531 [[Property Specification Language]] (PSL) * IEC TS 62556 Ultrasonics – Field characterization – Specification and measurement of field parameters for high intensity therapeutic ultrasound (HITU) transducers and systems * IEC 62560 Self-ballasted LED-lamps for general lighting services by voltage > 50 V – Safety specifications * IEC 62561 Lightning protection system components (LPSC) * IEC 62605 Multimedia systems and equipment – Multimedia e-publishing and e-books – Interchange format for e-dictionaries * IEC 62606 General requirements for arc fault detection devices * IEC 62612 Self-ballasted LED lamps for general lighting services with supply voltages > 50 V – Performance requirements * [[IEC 62680]] [[Universal Serial Bus]] (USB) interfaces for data and power * [[IEC 62682]] Management of alarm systems for the process industries * IEC 62684 Interoperability specifications of [[common external power supply]] (EPS) for use with data-enabled mobile telephones * IEC/TR 62685 Industrial communication networks – Profiles – Assessment guideline for safety devices using IEC 61784-3 functional safety communication profiles (FSCPs) * IEC 62693 Industrial electroheating installations – Test methods for infrared electroheating installations * [[IEC 62700]] DC Power supply for notebook computer * IEC 62703 Expression of performance of fluorometric oxygen analyzers in liquid media * IEC 62708 Documents kinds for electrical and instrumentation projects in the process industry * IEC 62717 LED modules for general lighting – Performance requirements * IEC 62734 Industrial networks – Wireless communication network and communication profiles – ISA 100.11a * IEC 62752 In-cable control and protection device for mode 2 charging of electric roadvehicles * IEC 62769 Field device integration (FDI) * IEC 62776 Double-capped LED lamps designed to retrofit linear fluorescent lamps – Safety specifications * IEC/TR 62794 Industrial-process measurement, control and automation – Reference model for representation of production facilities (digital factory) * IEC/TR 62795 Interoperation guide of field device tool (FDT) / device type manager (DTM) and electronic device description language (EDDL) * IEC/TS 62796 Energy efficiency in electroheating installations * IEC 62798 Industrial electroheating equipment – Test methods for infrared emitters * IEC/TR 62837 Energy efficiency through automation systems * IEC 62885 Dry vacuum cleaners for household or similar use – Methods for measuring the performance * IEC/TS 62872 Industrial-process measurement, control and automation system interface between industrial facilities and the smart grid * IEC/TR 62914 Secondary cells and batteries containing alkaline or other non-acid electrolytes – Experimental procedure for the forced internal short-circuit test of IEC 62133:2012 * IEC/PAS 62948 Industrial networks – Wireless communication network and communication profiles – WIA-FA * IEC/PAS 62953 Industrial communication networks – Fieldbus specifications – ADS-net * [[IEC 63110]] Protocol for the management of [[electric vehicles]] charging and discharging infrastructures * [[IEC 80000]] Quantities and units * IEC 80001 Application of risk management for IT-networks incorporating medical devices * IEC TR 80002 Medical device software * [[ISO/TS 80004|IEC TS 80004]] [[Nanotechnologies]] * IEC PAS 80005 Utility connections in port * IEC 80369 Small-bore connectors for liquids and gases in healthcare applications * IEC 80416 Basic principles for graphical symbols for use on equipment * IEC 80601 Medical electrical equipment * IEC 81346 Industrial systems, installations and equipment and industrial products – Structuring principles and reference designations * IEC 81714 Design of graphical symbols for use in the technical documentation of products * IEC 82045 Document management * IEC 82079 Preparation of instructions for use – Structuring, content and presentation * IEC 82304 Health software * IEC 88528 Reciprocating internal combustion engine driven alternating current generating sets

revision.comment: minor fixes
revision.text:
{{Other uses|Continuity (disambiguation){{!}}Continuity}} In mathematics, the terms '''continuity''', '''continuous''', and '''continuum''' are used in a variety of related ways.
== Continuity of functions and measures ==
* [[Continuous function]]. * [[Absolute continuity|Absolutely continuous function]]. * [[Absolute continuity#Absolute continuity of measures|Absolute continuity of a measure with respect to another measure]]. * [[Continuous probability distribution]]. Sometimes this term is used to mean a probability distribution whose [[cumulative distribution function]] (c.d.f.) is (simply) continuous. Sometimes it has a less inclusive meaning: a distribution whose c.d.f. is [[absolute continuity|absolutely continuous]] with respect to [[Lebesgue measure]]. This less inclusive sense is equivalent to the condition that every set whose Lebesgue measure is 0 has probability 0.
== Continuum ==
* [[Continuum (set theory)]], the [[real line]] or the corresponding cardinal number. * [[Linear continuum]], any ordered set that shares certain properties of the real line. * [[Continuum (topology)]], a nonempty compact connected [[metric space]] (sometimes a [[Hausdorff space]]). * [[Continuum hypothesis]], a conjecture of Georg Cantor that there is no cardinal number between that of countably infinite sets and the cardinality of the set of all real numbers. The latter cardinality is equal to the cardinality of the set of all subsets of a countably infinite set. * [[Cardinality of the continuum]], a cardinal number that represents the size of the set of real numbers.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Continuity-related mathematical topics}} [[Category:Mathematical analysis]] [[Category:Mathematics-related lists]]

revision.comment: /* Integrated into the Linux kernel */ Rm LUKS, full disk encryption, not a filesystem
revision.text:
{{Portal|Cryptography}} {{Primary sources|date=August 2014}} This is a list of filesystems with support for [[filesystem-level encryption]]. Not to be confused with [[full-disk encryption]].
==General-purpose filesystems with encryption== * [[AdvFS]] on Digital Tru64 UNIX * [[Novell Storage Services]] on Novell NetWare and Linux * [[NTFS]] with [[Encrypting File System]] (EFS) for [[Microsoft Windows]] * [[ZFS]] since Pool Version 30 * [[Ext4]], added in [[Linux kernel]] 4.1<ref>{{cite web|url=https://lwn.net/Articles/639427/|title=Ext4 encryption [LWN.net]|author=|date=|website=lwn.net|accessdate=23 April 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180219072915/https://lwn.net/Articles/639427/|archivedate=19 February 2018|df=}}</ref> on June 2015 * [[F2FS]], added in Linux 4.2<ref>https://marc.info/?l=linux-kernel&m=143517753413580 {{Primary source inline|date=June 2015}}</ref> * [[APFS]]
==Cryptographic filesystems== <!-- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- NB! Before adding any entries to this list, please make sure the entry is itself a first-class *file system* that implements cryptography. When in doubt, please consult the [[filesystem-level encryption]] article or ask on the discussion page. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --> ===[[Filesystem in Userspace|FUSE]]-based file systems=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !File system !Latest release |- |CryFS |2016<ref>{{Cite web|title = CryFS: A cryptographic file system for the cloud|url = https://www.cryfs.org|accessdate = 2016-09-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20161001235215/http://www.cryfs.org/|archivedate = 2016-10-01|df = }}</ref> |- |gocryptfs |2018<ref>{{Cite web|title = gocryptfs: simple. secure. fast.|url = https://nuetzlich.net/gocryptfs/|accessdate = 2018-03-07|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180302055001/https://nuetzlich.net/gocryptfs/|archivedate = 2018-03-02|df = }}</ref> |- |securefs |2018<ref>{{Cite web|title = Release 0.8.2 · netheril96/securefs |url = https://github.com/netheril96/securefs/releases/tag/0.8.2|accessdate = 2018-11-10|deadurl = no}}</ref> |- |[[EncFS]] |2016<ref>{{Cite web|title = vgough/encfs|url = https://github.com/vgough/encfs/releases|website = GitHub|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160117181347/https://github.com/vgough/encfs/releases|archivedate = 2016-01-17|df = }}</ref> |- |LessFS<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lessfs.com/ |title=Lessfs |publisher=Lessfs.com |accessdate=2014-02-03 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140130011245/http://www.lessfs.com/ |archivedate=2014-01-30 |df= }}</ref> |2013<ref>{{Cite web|title = lessfs - data deduplication for less - Browse Files at SourceForge.net|url = http://sourceforge.net/projects/lessfs/files/|website = sourceforge.net|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160117181347/http://sourceforge.net/projects/lessfs/files/|archivedate = 2016-01-17|df = }}</ref> |- |MetFS<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|title = Metin KAYA - MetFS Encrypted, Dynamic Sized, Single File, FUSE Based Filesystem in Userspace|url = http://www.enderunix.org/metfs/|website = www.enderunix.org|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160217094139/http://www.enderunix.org/metfs/|archivedate = 2016-02-17|df = }}</ref> |2012<ref name=":0" /> |- | colspan="2" |''Discontinued projects'' |- |CryptoFS<ref>{{Cite web|title = Reboot's personal page|url = https://reboot.github.io/cryptofs/|website = reboot.github.io|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160128075413/http://reboot.github.io/cryptofs/|archivedate = 2016-01-28|df = }}</ref> |2007<ref>{{Cite web|title = Reboot's personal page|url = https://reboot.github.io/cryptofs/#AEN74|website = reboot.github.io|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160128075413/http://reboot.github.io/cryptofs/#AEN74|archivedate = 2016-01-28|df = }}</ref> |- |Magikfs<ref>{{Cite web|title = Magikfs – The Steganographic File System On Linux|url = http://magikfs.sourceforge.net/|website = magikfs.sourceforge.net|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304081132/http://magikfs.sourceforge.net/|archivedate = 2016-03-04|df = }}</ref> |2006<ref>{{Cite web|title = magikfs-The steganographic filesystem - Browse Files at SourceForge.net|url = http://sourceforge.net/projects/magikfs/files/|website = sourceforge.net|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160308034046/https://sourceforge.net/projects/magikfs/files/|archivedate = 2016-03-08|df = }}</ref> |- |PhoneBookFS<ref>{{Cite web|title = Phonebook - Software to Make Your PC 'Police-Ready'|url = http://freenet.mcnabhosting.com/python/phonebook/|website = freenet.mcnabhosting.com|accessdate = 2016-01-05|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160305160239/http://freenet.mcnabhosting.com/python/phonebook/|archivedate = 2016-03-05|df = }}</ref> |2004<ref>{{Cite web|url =http://freenet.mcnabhosting.com/python/phonebook/ChangeLog.txt|title =Changelog for phonebook|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20160117181347/http://freenet.mcnabhosting.com/python/phonebook/ChangeLog.txt|archivedate =2016-01-17|df =}}</ref> |}
===Integrated into the Linux kernel=== * [[eCryptfs]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ecryptfs |title=eCryptfs in Launchpad |publisher=Launchpad.net |date= |accessdate=2014-02-03 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140209201633/https://launchpad.net/ecryptfs |archivedate=2014-02-09 |df= }}</ref> * [[Rubberhose filesystem]] (discontinued)<ref>[http://iq.org/~proff/rubberhose.org/] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060902083210/http://iq.org/~proff/rubberhose.org/|date=September 2, 2006}}</ref> * [[StegFS]] (discontinued)
===Integrated into other UNIXes=== * [[PEFS]] (Private Encrypted File System) on FreeBSD<ref>{{cite web |url=https://github.com/glk/pefs |title=glk/pefs 路 GitHub |publisher=Github.com |date= |accessdate=2014-02-03 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140722172341/https://github.com/glk/pefs |archivedate=2014-07-22 |df= }}</ref> * [[Encrypting File System|EFS]] (Encrypted File System) on AIX<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/aix/library/au-efs/|title=Understanding EFS|author=|date=29 January 2008|website=www.ibm.com|accessdate=23 April 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819191300/http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/aix/library/au-efs/|archivedate=19 August 2016|df=}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Comparison of disk encryption software]]
==References== {{Reflist}}

page.title: List of international presidential trips made by Hassan Rouhani

revision.comment: Removing [[:c:File:Iranian_President_Hassan_Rouhani_receives_a_ceremonial_welcome_at_Rashtrapati_Bhavan_(1).jpg|Iranian_President_Hassan_Rouhani_receives_a_ceremonial_welcome_at_Rashtrapati_Bhavan_(1).jpg]], it has been deleted from Commons by [[:c:User:R
revision.text:
[[File:President Rouhani travels to U.S., 2013 05.jpg|thumb|300px|President Rouhani in [[Mehrabad Airport]], leaving [[Tehran]] for [[New York City]].]] This is a '''list of international presidential trips made by [[Hassan Rouhani]]''', the [[List of Presidents of Iran|7th]] and current [[President of Iran|President]] of [[Iran]] ==Summary of international trips== {{further|Foreign relations of Iran}} [[File:Hassan Rouhani foreign trips.png|thumb|center|500px|Map of international trips made by Hassan Rouhani as president: {{legend|#808000|1 visit}} {{legend|#008000|2 visits}} {{legend|#008080|3 visits}} {{legend|#0000FF|4 visits}} {{legend|#FF00FF|5 visits}} {{legend|#800080|6 visits}} {{legend|#800000|7 or more visits}} {{legend|#000000|Iran}}]] ==2013== The following international trips were made by President Hassan Rouhani in 2013: {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Kyrgyzstan}} [[Kyrgyzstan]] |[[Bishkek]] |September 12[http://president.ir/en/71044 President off to Kyrgyzstan]–13[http://president.ir/en/71178 President explains the aims and achievements of the Iranian delegation at the SCO] |{{further|Iran-Kyrgyzstan relations}}President Rouhani's [[state visit]] to [[Kyrgyzstan]] was his first trip outside Iran as president. He attended [[Shanghai Cooperation Organisation]] head of states summit on 13 September 2013.[http://president.ir/en/71046 President arrives in Bishkek for SCO Summit] He chaired the summit as the second spokesperson after Kyrgyzstan's [[Almazbek Atambayev]]. He said that deems disarmament and nuclear non-proliferation necessary for international peace and stability, reiterating that Tehran is committed to the Non-proliferation Treaty (NPT) based on its “legal commitments, religious and moral tenets and strategic considerations.” President further called for political will, mutual respect, and confidence-building measures to resolve the West’s nuclear dispute with Iran. He said that the Islamic Republic insists on the “inalienable right of all NPT member states to enjoy peaceful nuclear technology.” Rouhani also said Russia’s plan for placing the Syrian chemical weapons under international control and Syria's response to the proposed plan inspire hope for avoiding [[Syrian civil war|war]].[http://president.ir/en/71123 President Rouhani's speech at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit] He also met with [[Almazbek Atambayev]] of [[Kyrgyzstan]],[http://president.ir/en/71057 President Rouhani talks with Kyrgyz counterpart] [[Vladimir Putin]] of [[Russia]],[http://president.ir/en/71150 President Rouhani meets Russian counterpart] [[Hamid Karzai]] of [[Afghanistan]],[http://president.ir/en/71097 President Rouhani confers with Afghan president] [[Emomali Rahmon]] of [[Tajikistan]],[http://president.ir/en/71111 Dr.Rouhani confers with Tajik president] [[Xi Jinping]] of [[People's Republic of China]],[http://president.ir/en/71055 President Rouhani confers with Chinese counterpart in Bishkek] [[Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj]] of [[Mongolia]],[http://president.ir/en/71113President Rouhani confers with his Mongolian counterpart]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]] of [[Kazakhstan]][http://president.ir/en/71110 President Rouhani confers with his Kazakh counterpart] and [[Salman Khurshid]] of [[India]][http://president.ir/en/71115 President Rouhani confers with Indian Foreign Minister] |- |{{Flag icon|United Nations}} [[United Nations]] |[[New York City]] |September 23[http://president.ir/en/71532 President Rouhani arrives in New York]–28[http://president.ir/en/72081 President returns home from New York] |{{further|Iran-United States relations}}Rouhani visited [[United States]] to attend [[Sixty-eighth session of the United Nations General Assembly]]. He [[General debate of the sixty-eighth session of the United Nations General Assembly|addressed]] the assembly on afternoon of 24 September 2013.[http://president.ir/en/71646 President Rouhani's speech at the United Nations General Assembly] He also addressed at [[Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons]] and [[Non-Aligned Movement]]'s foreign ministers meeting.[http://president.ir/en/71828 Dr.Rouhani's speech in NAM Conference on Disarmament to monitor annihilation of nuclear weapons] He met with French President [[Francois Hollande]],[http://president.ir/en/71649 Iranian – French presidents meet on UN General Assembly][https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-24183638 France's Hollande to meet Iran's Rouhani at UN] Turkish President [[Abdullah Gul]],[http://president.ir/en/71809 Dr.Rouhani confers with Turkish President] Tunisian President [[Moncef Marzouki]],[http://president.ir/en/71721 Dr.Rouhani confers with his Tunisian counterpart] Austrian President [[Heinz Fischer]],[http://president.ir/en/71592 President Rouhani confers with Austrian counterpart] Lebanese President [[Michel Suleiman]],[http://president.ir/en/71722 Dr.Rouhani meets with Lebanese president] Iraqi Vice President [[Khodair al-Khozaei]],[http://president.ir/en/71762 President Rouhani meets with Iraqi vice president] Italian Prime Minister [[Enrico Letta]],[http://president.ir/en/71874 President Rouhani confers with Italy's Prime Minister] Spanish Prime Minister [[Mariano Rajoy]][http://president.ir/en/71871 President Rouhani confers with Spanish PM] Japanese Prime Minister [[Shinzo Abe]],[http://president.ir/en/71852 Dr.Rouhani confers with Japanese PM] Pakistani Prime Minister [[Nawaz Sharif]],[http://president.ir/en/71684 Dr.Rohani confers with Nawaz Sharif] Fijian Prime Minister [[Frank Bainimarama]],[http://president.ir/en/71682 Dr.Rouhani meets with Fijian Prime Minister] German Foreign Minister [[Guido Westerwelle]],[http://president.ir/en/71696 President Rouhani meets with German Foreign Minister] [[United Nations]] Secretary General [[Ban Ki-moon]],[http://president.ir/en/71985 Dr.Rouhani meets with UN Secretary General] [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]] Secretary General [[Ekmeleddin İhsanoğlu]],[http://president.ir/en/71720 President meets with OIC Secretary General] [[European Council]] President [[Herman Van Rompuy]][http://president.ir/en/71855 Dr.Rouhani meets with the President of the European Council] United Nation's Special Envoy on Syria [[Lakhdar Brahimi]][http://president.ir/en/71867 President Rouhani confers with the UN Secretary Generals Special Envoy on Syria Affairs] and [[International Monetary Fund]] Chief [[Christine Lagarde]].[http://president.ir/en/71665 President, IMF chief meet in NY][http://khabaronline.ir/detail/314245/Politics/diplomacy President Rouhani's plans in the United States] [[White House]] indicated that President [[Barack Obama]] could meet Rouhani in an unofficial meeting but that didn't occur.[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/sep/20/barack-obama-hassan-rouhani-iran-un White House indicates Obama could meet Iran president Rouhani at UN][http://hotair.com/archives/2013/09/20/will-obama-and-rouhani-meet-at-the-un-next-week/ Will Obama and Rouhani meet at the UN next week?] White House later published a statement announcing that President Rouhani has rejected Obama's invitation for a face-to-face meeting. Rouhani was later interviewed with [[CNN]] during which he welcomed the possibility of relations with the [[United States]].[http://president.ir/en/71679 Dr.Rouhani's interview with CNN] He was also invited and spoke at [[Council on Foreign Relations]]. |} ==2014== The following international trips were made by President Hassan Rouhani in 2014: {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Switzerland}} [[Switzerland]] |[[Davos]] |January 22[http://president.ir/en/74037 To attend World Economic Forum, President off to Davos]–24[http://president.ir/en/74297 President Rouhani returns home] |{{further|Iran-Switzerland relations}}President Rouhani marked his first European visit to Switzerland. Rouhani addressed at the 44th [[World Economic Forum]].[http://president.ir/en/74125 President’s speech addressing the 44th world Economic Forum] Rouhani is due to meet with a number of leaders of the participating states. President Rouhani will also attend interviews with international news networks and media. President Hassan Rouhani, met with his Swiss counterpart and Member of the Swiss Federal Council [[Didier Burkhalter]], discussed issues of mutual interest and global problems.[http://president.ir/en/74184 President Rouhani confers with his Swiss counterpart] President Hassan Rouhani met with Dutch Prime Minister [[Mark Rutte]], stressed that both sides enjoy huge capacity to boost all-out relations, economic cooperation in particular.[http://president.ir/en/74099 Iran –Netherlands enjoy huge capacity to boost all-out relations] He also met with his Azerbaijan Republic counterpart [[Ilham Aliyev]], discussed issues of mutual interest with him.[http://president.ir/en/74183 Iran ready to transfer its experiences to Azerbaijan Republic] Rouhani also meted with President of European Commission [[José Manuel Barroso]] and has welcomed the development of relations between the Islamic Republic and European countries.[http://president.ir/en/74186 There is a suitable ground for the expansion of ties with Europe] Rouhani attended a meeting in presence of several managing directors of oil and gas companies on the sideline of the 44th World Economic Forum currently underway in Davos, Switzerland.[http://president.ir/en/74115 President attends oil, gas meeting in Davos] President Hassan Rouhani, on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum (WEF) told world big oil companies directors that there are a lot of opportunities and very low risks and costs in investment in Iran.[http://president.ir/en/74190 President in a meeting with world big oil companies directors] Rouhani invited world investors and industrialists to invest in all branches of Iran’s industry, especially in energy and automobile ones and participate in Iran’s economic development experience.[http://president.ir/en/74233 President in a meeting with industrialists and directors of big companies] |- |{{Flag icon|Oman}} [[Oman]] |[[Muscat, Oman|Muscat]] |March 11[http://president.ir/en/75874 President arrives in Oman][http://president.ir/en/75880 President officially welcomed by Sultan Qaboos]–13[http://president.ir/en/75963 President left Oman for Tehran] |{{further|Arab League–Iran relations}}President Rouhani visits Oman as his first Middle Eastern and Persian Gulf state in a two-days state visit of Oman. President and the [[Sultan Qaboos]] stressed development of relations between the two countries in all fields including energy, shipping, customs affairs, financial issues, environment, and tourism and maintaining Hormuz Strait security. The two leaders noted that regional tensions could be resolved through dialogue among regional countries.[http://president.ir/en/75899 Iran-Oman ties example of good-neighborliness] |- |{{Flag icon|Afghanistan}} [[Afghanistan]] |[[Kabul]] |March 27[http://president.ir/en/76244 President departs for Kabul to attend Nowrouz Festival][http://president.ir/en/76302 President leaves Kabul for Tehran] |{{further|Iran-Afghanistan relations}}Rouhani visits Afghanistan to attend [[Nowrouz]] festival with Persian language countries heads of states and governments. President Rouhani underlined the necessity of immediate withdrawal of all foreign forces from Afghanistan so that Afghan security could be maintained by Afghanistanˈs central government in a meeting with Afghan president [[Hamid Karzai]] after the ceremonies.[http://president.ir/en/76329 President Rouhani confers with Afghan president] Rouhani underlines joint action to maintain security, fight against terrorism, extremism in quardriateral meeting with Presidents of Afghanistan, Pakistan and Tajikistan.[http://president.ir/en/76335 President underlines joint action to maintain security, fight against terrorism, extremism] |- |{{Flag icon|People's Republic of China}} [[China]] |[[Beijing]]
[[Shanghai]] |May 20[http://president.ir/en/77626 President departed for China to attend CICA][http://president.ir/en/77648 President arrives in China]–22[http://president.ir/en/77854 President left Shanghai for Tehran] |{{further|Iran-China relations}} Rouhani travelled to [[People's Republic of China]] to attend the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia. Rouhani said that presence of Iran in the upcoming summit of the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA) is of great significance for restoration of peace and stability to the region.[http://president.ir/en/77630 Iran's economic ties with east / China is important to Iran][http://president.ir/en/77670 The conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA) opens in Shanghai by the presence of Dr.Rouhani] Rouhani opened the summit, noted that bolstering economic ties and joint investment schemes between CICA members can effectively help with regional convergence in a globalized economy and expressed Iran’s views on various regional and international issues.[http://president.ir/en/77675 Iran’ strategies for regional convergence in a globalized economy][http://president.ir/en/77691 Durable peace and security can only be achieved through the promotion of a culture of prudent moderation, tolerance and dialogue] Rouhani also met with his Chinese, Russian,[http://president.ir/en/77729 Iran-Russia cooperation will contribute to the establishment of stability and security in the region] Kazakh[http://president.ir/en/77715 President calls for boosting Iran - Kazakhstan cooperation] and Sri Lankan[http://president.ir/en/77742 Rouhani confers with Sri Lankan counterpart] counterparts. He also confers with [[United Nations]] Secretary General [[Ban Ki-moon]].[http://president.ir/en/77739 President confers with UN chief] |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Ankara]] |June 9[http://president.ir/en/78289 Iranian president off to Ankara]–11[http://president.ir/en/78491 President leave Ankara for Tehran] |{{further|Iran-Turkey relations}} The visit is taking place at the official invitation of Turkish President [[Abdullah Gul]]. President Rouhani met several senior Turkish officials including his counterpart and Prime Minister [[Recep Tayyip Erdogan]].[http://president.ir/en/78369 President Rouhani meets Turkish prime minister] The President will also attend the first meeting of a joint committee for strategic cooperation, which was set up during Erdoganˈs trip to Tehran earlier this year.[http://president.ir/en/78264 President to attend press conference in Turkey][http://president.ir/en/78340 Rouhani officially welcomed by Turkish counterpart] The two countries presidents exchanged views on the most important issues of mutual interest as well as the latest regional and international developments.[http://president.ir/en/78341 Iranian, Turkish presidents hold bilateral talks] President Hassan Rouhani reiterated that the economic cooperation between Iran and Turkey can help to improvement of economic conditions of the regional countries.[http://president.ir/en/78386 Iran-Turkey economic convergence helps region's economies][http://president.ir/en/78404 Iran and Turkey strong will to remove all obstacles to expansion bilateral ties][http://president.ir/en/78365 Rouhani, Gul stressed the necessity for increasing their bilateral trade to $30bln] Iran and Turkey also have signed 10 accords of cooperation in a meeting both presidents attended. The agreements reportedly were intended to ‘deepen bilateral relations between Tehran and Ankara’ more than ever.[http://president.ir/en/78347 Iran, Turkey sign 10 accords][http://president.ir/en/78416 President at a joint press conference with Turkish PM] |- |{{Flag icon|Kazakhstan}} [[Kazakhstan]] |[[Astana]] |September 8[http://president.ir/en/80565 President off to Kazakhstan][http://president.ir/en/80585 President Rouhani officially received by Kazakh counterpart in the presidential palace]–10[http://president.ir/en/80651 President departs Astana for SCO summit in Tajikistan] |{{further|Iran-Kazakhstan relations}} A high-ranking political and economic delegation, including a number of cabinet ministers, were accompanying Rouhani in his visit to Kazakhstan. President Rouhani pointed that Kazakhstan is an important neighbor of Iran, added that there is an extensive relation between Iran and the Kazakhstan in economy, science and technology fields.[http://president.ir/en/80562 There are close ties between Iran and Kazakhstan in various fields][http://president.ir/en/80626 Volume of economic exchanges between Iran and Kazakhstan will increase five times more][http://president.ir/en/80640 Iran seeking closer ties with regional countries, neighbors][http://president.ir/en/80632 Iran’s economy is in the international limelight / Kazakhstan has a special situation and priority] Iran and Kazakhstan also signed several agreements on cooperation in the fields of transportation, trade exchange and industry.[http://president.ir/en/80611 Private negotiations of Iran, Kazakh president / Iran, Kazakhstan sign cooperation agreements] |- |{{Flag icon|Tajikistan}} [[Tajikistan]] |[[Dushanbe]] |September 10[http://president.ir/en/80683 President arrives in Tajikistan / Official welcome at the Nations Palace (Kohi Millat)]–13[http://president.ir/en/80827 Pres.Rouhani back in Tehran from Central Asian tour] |{{further|Iran-Tajikistan relations}} Rouhani traveled to Tajikistan for attending [[Shanghai Cooperation Organisation]] [[2014 SCO summit|summit]].[http://president.ir/en/80789 SCO summit kicks off in Dushanbe by the presence of Dr.Rouhani][http://president.ir/en/80833 The member states SCO seeks enhanced ties with Iran] In addition to summit, he met Tajik president [[Emomali Rahmon]][http://president.ir/en/80692 Iran, Tajik presidents start official talks][http://president.ir/en/80726 Iran and Tajikistan are as a part of a large and lofty building in the region][http://president.ir/en/80715 Rouhani and his Tajik counterpart call for the promotion Tehran-Dushanbe cooperation] and conferred with his Chinese,[http://president.ir/en/80811 President Rouhani confers with Chinese president] Russian,[http://president.ir/en/80818 Presidents of Iran-Russia call for enhanced Tehran-Moscow political ties] Uzbek,[http://president.ir/en/80780 Iran, Uzbekistan presidents call for closer ties] Turkmen[http://president.ir/en/80792 The Iranian and Turkmen presidents stressed the need to promote Tehran-Ashgabat cooperation] and Afghan[http://president.ir/en/80813 President confers with Afghan counterpart] presidents, as well as the Indian prime minister [[Narendra Modi]] during his two-day visit of Tajikistan. He discussed with Russian president [[Vladimir Putin]] on the course of nuclear talks between Iran and the P5+1 and voiced support for reaching a comprehensive solution between the negotiating parties by the November 24 deadline. Rouhani also attended the unveiling ceremony of Sangtuda 2 Hydroelectric Power Plant by video conference.[http://president.ir/en/80721 Inauguration of Sangtuda 2 Power Plant in Tajikistan] |- |{{Flag icon|United Nations}} [[United Nations]] |[[New York City]] |September 22[http://president.ir/en/81100 President arrives in New York]–28[http://president.ir/en/81473 President leaves New York for Astrakhan] |{{further|Iran-United States relations}} President Rouhani arrived in New York's [[John F Kennedy Airport]] on 22 September to take part in the [[Sixty-eighth session of the United Nations General Assembly|Sixty-ninth annual meeting]] of the [[United Nations General Assembly]]. He met with French President [[François Hollande]],[http://president.ir/en/81176 Global issues should resolve through dialogue / West should comprehend that Iran is influential power in the region] Austrian President [[Heinz Fischer]],[http://president.ir/en/81206 Iran can be a reliable energy source for EU / Iran ready to transfer gas to Europe through Austria] Venezuelan President [[Nicolás Maduro]],[http://president.ir/en/81161 President calls for expanding Iran- Venezuela relations] Turkish President [[Recep Tayyip Erdogan]],[http://president.ir/en/81152 President Rouhani confers with Turkish President] Slovenian President [[Borut Pahor]],[http://president.ir/en/81284 Rouhani confers with Slovenian president] Iraqi President [[Fuad Masum]],[http://president.ir/en/81350 Iran seeks Iraq's unity] Guinean President [[Alpha Condé]][http://president.ir/en/81448 Iran - Guinea presidents call for development of bilateral relations] Bolivian President [[Evo Morales]],[http://president.ir/en/81302 Iran gives priority to expansion of relations with revolutionary and independent countries] United Kingdom Prime Minister [[David Cameron]],[http://president.ir/en/81247 President Meets UK Prime Minister in New York] Japanese Prime Minister [[Shinzō Abe]],[http://president.ir/en/81141 Iran consider Japan as a friend] Iraqi Prime Minister [[Haider al-Abadi]],[http://president.ir/en/81301 Middle East development depends on the unity of the countries of the region / Iran not seeking permission for supporting Iraq] Lebanese Prime Minister [[Tammam Salam]],[http://president.ir/en/81418 Lebanon's security and development is guaranteed with the presence of all ethnic and religious groups ] Georgian Prime Minister [[Irakli Garibashvili]],[http://president.ir/en/81372 Iran favors the stability and security of Georgia / Iran ready for boosting economic ties with Georgia] German Foreign Minister [[Frank-Walter Steinmeier]],[http://president.ir/en/81375 Political will of the G5+1 easier way to reach a comprehensive agreement] UN Secretary General [[Ban Ki-moon]][http://president.ir/en/81207 World’s biggest problem is powers hegemony] and European Union President [[Herman Van Rompuy]][http://president.ir/en/81295 President confers with the head of Council of Europe] on the sideline of the United Nations General Assembly session. Rouhani [[General debate of the sixty-ninth session of the United Nations General Assembly|addressed]] United Nations General Assembly on Morning schedule of 25 September.[http://president.ir/en/81324 Statement by the president of the Islamic Republic of Iran at the 69th Session of the UN General Assembly] President Rouhani also addressed global concern on climate change in his speech at the Climate Summit in the UN headquarters in New York.[http://president.ir/en/81145 President’s speech at the Climate Summit in the UN headquarters in New York] |- |{{Flag icon|Russia}} [[Russia]] |[[Astrakhan]] |September 28[http://president.ir/en/81485 President arrives in Astrakhan]–30[http://president.ir/en/81573 President back in Tehran from New York and Astrakhan] |{{further|Iran-Russia relations}} Rouhani arrived Astrakhan from [[New York City]] to attend in 4th summit of the [[Caspian Sea]] Littoral state. The heads of Caspian states signed four cooperation pacts and issue a joint statement.[http://president.ir/en/81551 Caspian Sea states sign three agreements, a joint statement][http://president.ir/en/81555The summit and its documents shows countries’ will to cooperate on Caspian issues]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He also held talks with Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]].[http://president.ir/en/81567 Iran, Russia presidents review bilateral cooperation] |- |{{Flag icon|Azerbaijan}} [[Azerbaijan]] |[[Baku]] |November 12[http://president.ir/en/82389 President leaves Tehran for Azerbaijan]–13[http://president.ir/en/82452 The achievements of visit to Azerbaijan, positive and in the interests of the two nations] |{{further|Iran-Azerbaijan relations}} Rouhani left for Baku, Azerbaijan for bilateral talks with high ranking Azeri officials. New era of Iran's engagement with other countries, the emphasis of the [[Government of Hassan Rouhani (2013–present)|government]] on promotion of relations with neighbors, huge economic capacities of Iran and the country's remarkable progress in various scientific and technological fields have prepared the ground for cooperation with Azerbaijan, a Muslim and neighboring country.[http://president.ir/en/82398 President officially welcomes by Ilham Aliyev] President Rouhani called the expansion of relations between Iran and Azerbaijan, and promoting the level of cooperation as the most important goals of his trip.[http://president.ir/en/82392 The establishing good relations with neighbors is 11th government‘s policy] Five agreements on bilateral cooperation signed between Iran and the Republic of Azerbaijan during visit to Baku of President Hassan Rouhani. Iran and Azerbaijan agreed to expand cooperation in the fields of energy, industry, transport and communications.[http://president.ir/en/82410 Signing 5 MoUs by the presence of Iran- Azerbaijan presidents][http://president.ir/en/82415 Iran seeks peace and friendship in the region][president.ir/en/82437 Joint Statement on Friendship and Cooperation between Iran and Azerbaijan] |} ==2015== The following international trips were made by President Hassan Rouhani in 2015: {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Turkmenistan}} [[Turkmenistan]] |[[Ashgabat]] |March 10[http://president.ir/en/85238 President off to Turkmenistan/ Top priority of Iran's foreign policy is expansion of relations with regional countries][http://president.ir/en/85244 Dr.Rouhani arrives in Ashgabat]–11[http://president.ir/en/85427 President leaves Ashgabat for Tehran] |{{further|Iran-Turkmenistan relations}}President Rouhani visited Iran's northeastern neighbor at the top of a high-ranking political, economic, and cultural delegation attended a dinner banquet thrown in his honor by his Turkmen counterpart, President [[Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedow]].[http://president.ir/en/85430 President officially welcomed by his Turkmen counterpart /Iranian, Turkmen presidents start talks in Ashgabad] In addition to meeting and holding talks with President Berdimuhamedow, President Rouhani attended the meeting of the two countries' high ranking delegations.[http://president.ir/en/85295 Presidents of Iran, Turkmenistan stress full-scale cooperation] It was at the end of that meeting the 17 cooperation documents were signed by the high-ranking officials of the two countries in the presence of both countries' presidents.[http://president.ir/en/85303 Iran, Turkmenistan Sign 17 Cooperation Documents] Offering an address at the meeting of merchants and economic activists of Iran and Turkmenistan and participation in a joint press conference were among the other activities of the Iranian president in this visit. |- |{{Flag icon|Indonesia}} [[Indonesia]] |[[Jakarta]] |April 21[http://www.president.ir/fa/86405 President off to Indonesia][http://president.ir/en/86408 President arrives in Indonesia]–23[http://president.ir/en/86508 Dr.Rouhani leaves Jakarta for Tehran] |{{further|Indonesia–Iran relations}} President Hassan Rouhani departed for Jakarta to attend a summit to be held in the Indonesian capital on April 22–24. The president is visiting Jakarta at the invitation of his Indonesian counterpart [[Joko Widodo]] to take part in the 60th anniversary of the [[Bandung Conference|Asian–African Conference]] known as Bandung Conference. On the sidelines of the conference, president Rouhani addressed the conference. Rouhani urged the international community to help eradicate terrorism and extremism.[http://president.ir/en/86436 President’s speech at the Asian-African Conference][http://president.ir/en/86423 President urges global action to stop terrorism] Rouhani met with Indonesian President Widodo which both sides referred to the importance of expanding and deepening cooperation between the two countries called for enhanced cooperation between Tehran and Jakarta on economic issues.[http://president.ir/en/86474 Development of economic cooperation between Tehran – Jakarta] He also met with Japanese Prime Minister [[Shinzo Abe]],[http://president.ir/en/86444 President confers with Japanese Prime Minister / Iran pleased with expansion of ties with Japan] Chinese President [[Xi Jinping]],[http://president.ir/en/86465 President confers with Chinese counterpart] Vietnamese President [[Truong Tan Sang]],[http://president.ir/en/86477 Dr.Rouhani: Iran Ready to invest and provide technical services in Vietnam Vietnamese president: Need to expand economic cooperation with Tehran] and Bangladeshi Prime Minister [[Sheikh Hasina]].[http://president.ir/en/86478 Iran welcomes the progress of Bangladesh and development of bilateral relations] Rouhani has called on Muslims all over the world to speak out against the terrorist groups twisting the image of Islam in a meeting with intellectuals and Muslim scholars in Indonesia.[http://president.ir/en/86513 President calls for collective action to deal with terror, extremism ] |- |{{Flag icon|Russia}} [[Russia]] |[[Ufa]] |July 8–10[http://president.ir/fa/87940 President off to Russia] |{{further|Iran-Russia relations}} [[7th BRICS summit]]
[[Shanghai Cooperation Organisation]] |- |{{Flag icon|United Nations}} [[United Nations]] |[[New York City]] |September 25–29[http://president.ir/fa/87940 President off to Russia]http://president.ir/fa/89722 |{{further|Iran-USA relations}} [[Seventieth session of the United Nations General Assembly]] |} ==2016== The following international trips were made by President Hassan Rouhani in 2016: {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Rome]] |January 25–27 |{{further|Iran-Italy relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Vatican City}} [[Vatican City]] |[[Vatican City]] |January 26 |{{further|Holy See-Iran relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |January 27–29 |{{further|France-Iran relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Pakistan}} [[Pakistan]] |[[Islamabad]] |March 25–26 |{{further|Pakistan-Iran relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Istanbul]] |April 13–15 |{{further|Turkey-Iran relations}}
[[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]] |- |{{Flag icon|Azerbaijan}} [[Azerbaijan]] |[[Baku]] |August 7–9 |{{further|Azerbaijan-Iran relations}}{{further|Iran-Russia relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Venezuela}} [[Venezuela]] |[[Porlamar]]
[[Caracas]] |September 16–19 |{{further|Iran-Venezuela relations}}
[[Non-Aligned Movement]] |- |{{Flag icon|Cuba}} [[Cuba]] |[[Havana]] |September 19–20 |{{further|Iran-Cuba relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|United Nations}} [[United Nations]] |[[New York City]] |September 20–23 |{{further|Iran-United States relations}}
[[Seventy-first session of the United Nations General Assembly]] |- |{{Flag icon|Vietnam}} [[Vietnam]] |[[Hanoi]] |October 5–7 |{{further|Iran-Vietnam relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Malaysia}} [[Malaysia]] |[[Kuala Lumpur]] |October 7–8 |{{further|Iran-Malaysia relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Thailand}} [[Thailand]] |[[Bangkok]] |October 8–10 |{{further|Iran-Thailand relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Armenia}} [[Armenia]] |[[Yerevan]] |December 21 |{{further|Iran-Armenia relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kazakhstan}} [[Kazakhstan]] |[[Astana]] |December 21–22 |{{further|Iran-Kazakhstan relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kyrgyzstan}} [[Kyrgyzstan]] |[[Bishkek]] |December 22–23 |{{further|Iran-Kyrgyzstan relations}} |} ==2017== The following international trips were made by President Hassan Rouhani in 2017: {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Oman}} [[Oman]] |[[Muscat, Oman|Muscat]] |February 15 |{{further|Iran-Oman relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kuwait}} [[Kuwait]] |[[Kuwait City]] |February 15–16 |{{further|Iran-Kuwait relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Pakistan}} [[Pakistan]] |[[Islamabad]] |February 28 – March 1{{Cite web|url=http://www.brecorder.com/2017/02/27/337959|title=Iranian President Rouhani to visit Pakistan for ECO Summit {{!}} Business Recorder|access-date=2017-02-28}}''' |{{further|Iran-Pakistan relations}}
[[13th ECO Summit]] |- |{{Flag icon|Russia}} [[Russia]] |[[Moscow]] |March 27-28 |{{further|Iran-Russia relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kazakhstan}} [[Kazakhstan]] |[[Astana]] |September 7–11[http://www.president.ir/fa/100629 دکتر روحانی آستانه را به مقصد تهران ترک کرد] |{{further|Iran-Kazakhstan relations}}
[[Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation#Islamic_Summits|1st OIC Summits on Science and Technology]] |- |{{Flag icon|United Nations}} [[United Nations]] |[[New York City]] |September 18–21[http://www.president.ir/fa/100702 دکتر روحانی به منظور شرکت در هفتاد و دومین نشست مجمع عمومی سازمان ملل عازم نیویورک شد] |{{further|Iran-United States relations}}
[[Seventy-second session of the United Nations General Assembly]] |- |{{Flag icon|Russia}} [[Russia]] |[[Sochi]] |November 22-23 |{{further|Iran-Russia relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Istanbul]] |December 13 |{{further|Iran-Turkey relations}}
[[Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation#Islamic_Summits|6th Extraordinary OIC Summits]] |- |} ==2018== The following international trips were made by President Hassan Rouhani in 2018: {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|India}}[[India]] |[[Hyderabad]]
[[New Delhi]] |February 15-17 |{{further|Iran-India relations}} |- |{{Flag icon|Turkmenistan}}[[Turkmenistan]] |[[Ashgabat]] |March 27 |{{further|Iran-Turkmenistan relations}}http://tdh.gov.tm/news/en/articles.aspx&article11999&cat26https://en.mehrnews.com/news/133001/Pres-Rouhani-to-visit-Turkmenistan-Azerbaijan |- |{{Flag icon|Azerbaijan}}[[Azerbaijan]] |[[Baku]] |March 28 |{{further|Iran-Azerbaijan relations}}http://www.presstv.com/Detail/2018/03/27/556654/Iran-President-Rouhani-Caspian-Azerbaijan-Turkmenistanhttps://www.azernews.az/nation/129393.html |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Ankara]] |April 4 |{{further|Iran-Turkey relations}}
Attended the second summit of Russia, Turkey and Iran. |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Istanbul]] |May 18 |{{further|Iran-Turkey relations}}
